From Cholula's hostile plain,</br>Left her treacherous legions slain,</br>Left her temples all in flame,</br>CORTES' conquering army came:</br>High on Chalco's stormy steep</br>Shone their phalanx broad and deep;</br>High the Hispanian banner rais'd,</br>Bore the Cross in gold emblaz'd.</br>Thick the gleaming spears appear'd,</br>Loud the neighing steeds were heard;</br>Flash'd the musquets lightnings round,</br>Roll'd their thunders o'er the ground,</br>Echo'd from a thousand caves,</br>Down to Tenustitan's waves;—</br>Spacious lake, that far below</br>Bade its lucid level flow:</br>There the ever-sunny shore</br>Groves of palm and coco bore;</br>Maize-fields rich, savannas green,</br>Stretch'd around, with towns between.</br>Tacuba, Tezeuco fair,</br>Rear'd their shining roofs in air;</br>Mexico's imperial pride</br>Glitter'd 'midst the glassy tide,</br>Bright with gold, with silver bright,</br>Dazzling, charming all the sight.</br>From their post the war-worn band</br>Raptur'd view'd the happy land:</br>"Haste to victory, haste to ease,</br>Mark the spot that gives us these!"
On the exulting heroes strode,</br>Shunn'd the smooth insidious road,</br>Shunn'd the rock's impending shade,</br>Shunn'd the expecting ambuscade.

Deep within a gloomy wood</br>MOTEZUME'S magicians stood:</br>TLCATLEPUCA'S horrid form,</br>God of famine, plague, and storm,</br>High on magic stones they rais'd;</br>Magic fires before him blaz'd;</br>Round the lurid flames they drew,</br>Flames whence steams of sulphur flew;</br>There, while bleeding victims smok'd,</br>Thus his aid they loud invok'd:

"Minister supreme of ill,</br>Prompt to punish, prompt to kill,</br>MOTEZUMA asks thy aid!</br>Foreign foes his realms invade;</br>Vengeance on the strangers shed,</br>Mix them instant with the dead!</br>By thy temple's sable floor,</br>By thy altar stain'd with gore,</br>Stain'd with gore and strew'd with bones,</br>Echoing shrieks, and echoing groans!</br>Vengeance on the strangers shed,</br>Mix them instant with the dead!"

ORDAZ heard, VELASQUEZ heard—</br>Swift their fauchions' blaze appear'd;</br>ALVARADO rushing near,</br>Furious rais'd his glittering spear;</br>Calm, OLMEDO mark'd the scene,</br>Calm he mark'd, and stepp'd between:</br>"Vain their rites and vain their prayer,</br>Weak attempts beneath your care;</br>Warriors!  let the wretches live!</br>Christians!  pity, and forgive!"</br>Sudden darkness o'er them spread,</br>Glow'd the woods with dusky red;</br>Vast the Idol's stature grew,</br>Look'd his face of ghastly hue,</br>Frowning rage, and frowning hate,</br>Angry at his nation's fate;</br>Fierce his fiery eyes he roll'd,</br>Thus his tongue the future told;</br>CORTES' veterans paus'd to hear;</br>Wondering all, tho' void of fear:

"Mourn, devoted city, mourn!</br>Mourn, devoted city, mourn!</br>Doom'd for all thy crimes to know</br>Scenes of battle, scenes of woe!</br>Who is he — O spare the sight!—</br>Rob'd in gold, with jewels bright?</br>Hark!  he deigns the crowd to call;</br>Chiefs and warriors prostrate fall.</br>Reverence now to fury yields;</br>Strangers o'er him spread your shields!</br>Thick the darts, the arrows, fly;</br>Hapless Monarch!  he must die!</br>Mark the solemn funeral state</br>Passing thro' the western gate!</br>Chapultequa's cave contains</br>Mighty MOTEZUME'S remains.

"Cease the strife!  alas, 'tis vain!</br>Myriads throng Otumba's plain;</br>Wide their feathery crests they wave,</br>All the strong and all the brave.</br>Gleaming glory thro' the skies,</br>See the Imperial standard flies!</br>Down by force resistless torn;</br>Off in haughty triumph borne.</br>Slaughter heaps the vale with dead,</br>Fugitives the mountains spread.

"Mexico, 'tis thine to know</br>More of battle, more of woe!—</br>Bright in arms the stranger train</br>O'er thy causeways move again.</br>Bend the bow, the shaft prepare,</br>Join the breastplate's folds with care;</br>Raise the sacrificial fire,</br>Bid the captive youths expire;</br>Wake the sacred trumpet's breath,</br>Pouring anguish, pouring death;</br>Troops from every street repair,</br>Close them in the fatal snare;</br>Valiant as they are, they fly,</br>Here they yield, and there they die.

"Cease the strife!  'tis fruitless all,</br>Mexico at last must fall!</br>Lo!  the dauntless band return,</br>Furious for the fight they burn!</br>Lo!  auxiliar nations round,</br>Crowding o'er the darken'd ground!</br>Corses fill thy trenches deep;</br>Down thy temple's lofty steep</br>See thy priests, thy princes thrown—</br>Hark!  I hear their parting groan!</br>Blood thy Lake with crimson dyes,</br>Flames from all thy domes arise!

"What are those that round thy shore</br>Launch thy troubled waters o'er?</br>Swift canoes that from the fight</br>Aid their vanquish'd monarch's flight;</br>Ambush'd in the reedy shade,</br>Them the stranger barks invade;</br>Soon thy lord a captive bends,</br>Soon thy far-fam'd empire ends;</br>Otomeca shares thy spoils,</br>Tlascala in triumph smiles.</br>Mourn, devoted city, mourn!</br>Mourn, devoted city, mourn!

"Cease your boast, O stranger band,</br>Conquerors of my fallen land!</br>Avarice strides your van before,</br>Phantom meagre, pale, and hoar!</br>Discord follows, breathing flame,</br>Still opposing claim to claim;</br>Kindred Daemons haste along!</br>Haste, avenge my country's wrong!"

Ceas'd the voice with dreadful sounds,</br>Loud as tides that burst their bounds;</br>Roll'd the form in smoke away,</br>Amaz'd on earth th' exorcists lay;</br>Pondering on the dreadful lore,</br>Their course the Iberians downward bore;</br>Their helmets glittering o'er the vale,</br>And wide their ensigns fluttering in the gale.</br>
